attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
A spot check in the cash office was carried out with the aim of ensuring cash at hand was tallying with that of the cash flow balance.

       It was noted that the cashier fully accounted for the expected cash balance of Ksh 1,000 as at 26.02.25. At the time of cash count there were IOUs for Ksh 39,100 and the cashier had banked Ksh 2,263,394
attributes.recommendation:
The cashier should maintain the controls.

A follow up should be made so that the IOUs are cleared.
attributes.effect: Company’s money was adequately safeguarded. IOUs should be cleared within a given time frame so as they are not used as a loophole to misplace company cash.

value: Cash was well controlled.
Cash well controlled. The IOUs were for vehicle inspection, staff allowances and weight and measures officials. We are making follow up for them to be cleared
Current
A spot check in the cash office was carried out with the aim of ensuring cash at hand was tallying with that of the cash flow balance.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Bread produced and packed in the branch were weighed randomly to determine if bread dispatched to the market was of the correct weight.

     From the sample selected audit noted that all varieties weighed had underweight cases with exception to 600g barrel white as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: Spot checks should be enhanced to ensure all production parameters are followed so as to eliminate cases of underweight. Slicers should be asked to pack bread as per production so that those overlooked do not overcool.
attributes.effect: Underweight bread dispatched to market exposes the company to risk of penalties if they are intercepted by the weight and measures officials.
attributes.remediation_plan: Enhanced spot checks by manager and supervisors to ensure standard weight is achieved.

value: We will enhance spot checks in packing section to ensure slicers do not overlook other varieties while packing.

The varieties with high prevalence cases of underweight was as a result of overlooking these varieties. I have advised the manager and supervisor to make follow up so that bread is packed as per production.
In a prior audit report the follow were underweight cases; 400g white-2.67%, 600 white-21.33%, 600 barrel white-22.67 and 800 white-1.33%
Current
Bread produced and packed in the branch were weighed randomly to determine if bread dispatched to the market was of the correct weight.
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description:
A physical stock take was conducted on 25.02.2025 with the aim of establishing whether internal controls were effective and whether physical stock items were matching with those in the SAP system. 

         After stock take, it was noted that most stock items had nil variations with exception to;

  •       Bread stock had -11.75 pieces cumulatively

  •       Poly bags had a variance of +243 pieces cumulatively

  •       Wheat bran variance of -0.55 kgs

  •       White ingredients 18Kgs -1 piece

  •       White ingredients 9Kgs +2 pieces

  •       Crates -11 pieces

         Details of the findings were as illustrated  in the table below;

Crates:

        As at the time of stock take, we had 3,992pcs while the manager's book had 3,994pcs hence a shortfall of 2 crates which the security personnel accepted liability hence the same will be recovered from him. A further check on SAP the branch is supposed to have 4,003pcs of crates.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should maintain stock controls. Accounts should adjust the balance of crates in the branch after recoveries
attributes.effect: Stocks were well controlled as depicted by minimal variances noted with exception to crates which had a shortfall of 2 pcs
attributes.remediation_plan: Crate adjustment in the the SAP system should be done to reflect the physical number after recovery of the two which got lost.

value:
Stock is well controlled and we will maintain.

         We will present documents to accounts to do adjustment of crates in the system
Stocks well controlled. Crate adjustment will be done after recovery
In a prior audit report dated 28.01.25 bread had    -38.25 loaves and polybags had +378 pieces
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Damages Check
attributes.description:
An analysis of production and market/supermarket damages was done to determine whether they were within the allowed percentage of 0.2% to total production and 0.5% of total sales respectively.

     A sample period of 26 days (1 to 26 February 2025) was used to analyse bread damages. Audit noted that the percentage of average production damages stood at 0.19% of the total production while average market damages was 0.26% of total sales as illustrated in the table below;

Damages sent to Ingredients

         For the same period damages sent to ingredients was less by19.05kgs
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should maintain control of bread damages by ensuring all production procedures are being followed and bread produced is of good quality.
attributes.effect: Both production and market bread damages were within the set limits.
attributes.remediation_plan: Damages were well controlled during the period

value: We will try our level best to maintain control
Noted and to be closely monitored and maintained.
In a prior audit report average production bread damages stood at 0.24% of total production while market damages stood at 0.23 of total sales
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Mixing charts and mixing chart summaries from 1 to 25 February 2025 were examined to find out the branch’s utto consumption, average yield, cases of remix and summation of totals.

         After examining the records the follow were noted;

  •        Average yield per bag was191.72loaves per bag.

  •        Utto consumption was at 100%.

  •       There were 618 tins of remix during the period

  •       Average production was 181.88 bags per day representing 80.84% of target which is 225 bags per day (Branch Capacity). However, as per the branch management the current target is 187 bags per day when using 25 decks instead of 30 decks meaning the achievement could have been 97.26%. I have used 225 bags per day when all 30 decks were in operation and production in 9 days was above 200 bags.

            The table below illustrates the findings;
attributes.recommendation: On those days the branch run on full capacity, the branch management should ensure production target is achieved. Overproof remixes can be controlled through follow up to ensure there’s no dough left to rise for too long.
attributes.effect: Target production in bags was not achieved meaning the branch’s capacity was under utilized. Remixes affects the quality of bread hence contributing to returns
attributes.remediation_plan: For the production target to be achieved, promoting of company products should be done within existing routes so as to reach to new customers which will increase sales and in turn production

value: Production depends on sales hence we have to control our balance. Remixes were caused by overproof

Our current target is 187 bags per day. During this period were produced more than 200 bags in some days because we were supplying Kisumu Branch as painting was taking place. Cases of remixes as a result of overproof will be controlled.
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Debtor Analysis
attributes.description:
Outstanding debts were analysed as at 1 March 2025 to check the magnitude.

         It was observed that the customers had outstanding balance of Ksh 228,160 while schools had balances amounting to Ksh 234,926 as illustrated in the table below;       

                Note: From the above analysis Nyakundi took Ksh 54,512 while Achoki took Ksh 170,413
attributes.recommendation:
A follow up should be made to recover the amount the turn boys took from their security deposits and final due if any.

         Sales rep should be informed on daily basis of those customers who haven’t paid so as to confirm if they gave cash to turn boys but never submitted the same to the company. Cashless system should be introduced to curb cases where turn boys run with day’s sales
attributes.effect: The company is exposed to risk of losing its revenue as the two turn boys run with sales money.
attributes.remediation_plan:
Follow up by sales representative should be done to ensure the outstanding balances are cleared. For the amount which turnboys took, should be recovered from final dues.

The branch should start a cashless system so as to reduce exposure to risk of losing revenue

value: Currently we follow up on daily basis balances not cleared.
Currently any amount which is not paid at the close of business, a follow up is made immediately to ascertain that the customer has not paid.
Current
Sales Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production efficiency calculation the month of February 2025 (1 to 25 February 2005) was done to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.

        It was noted that the average production efficiency was 4.43 bags per production worker as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should allocate production workers as per production target shift wise so as to ensure set efficiency is achieved
attributes.effect: The branch did not achieve the set production efficiency target meaning that the cost of production was above set budget
attributes.remediation_plan: Allocation production workers as per production target shift wise so as to ensure set efficiency is achieved

value: We are trying our best so as to achieve set target of 4.5 bags per production worker
We will put more effort to achieve set target of efficiency. I advise the  manager and supervisors should control efficiency by ensuring those hired achieve target
From prior audit report average production efficiency was 4.5bags per production worker
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Packing efficiency was calculated from 1 to 25 February 2025 to determine if the packers hired were achieving the set packing efficiency of 97 crates per packer.

          It was noted that the average packing efficiency was 96.50 crates per packer as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: Hiring of Packers shift wise should be guided by the number of bags produced in the prior shift. This will enable the branch to achieve set target
attributes.effect: Average packing efficiency was below the set target and this implies that packing cost was above the set budget hence an extra cost to the company
attributes.remediation_plan: Hiring of Packers shift wise should be guided by the number of bags produced in the prior shift

value: We are slightly below set target but we are working to achieve set target
Noted and to be improved
From prior audit report average packing efficiency was 94.87 crates per packer
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage and Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of fuel consumption was done from 1 to 26 February 2025 to assess;

  •        Whether the standard fuel consumption set for each vehicle was being met

         It was noted that vehicles fuel consumption was fairly controlled during the period. Rangwe route vehicle had issues with speedometer during the period hence calculating the actual rate of fuel used will not be accurate. An illustrated of the findings has been attached in appendix 1 below;
attributes.recommendation: Vehicles with faulty speedometer should be repaired so as to enable the manager to issue fuel as per distance covered.
attributes.effect: Using faulty vehicle my lead to over consuming fuel and tracking the  daily mileage will be  a challenge hence an extra cost to the company
attributes.remediation_plan: Routine maintenance of vehicles should be done by following set schedule

value: The vehicle for Rangwe route had challenges with speedometer but now it has been rectified.
The vehicle for Rangwe had issues with speedometer during the period but later it was repaired.
Current
Transport/Fleet Department

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
The generator consumption rate was reviewed from 1 to 28 February 2025 so as to determine the consumption rate. Average consumption for the period was 32.01litres per hour. During the period 515 litres of fuel had been purchased and the generator had run for 16.09hours.

         When the system hours were compared to the genset odometer physical reading, they were both in agreement.
attributes.recommendation: The controls should be maintained by the management
attributes.effect: The generator was well controlled.

value: Generator fuel consumption is well controlled as we only fuel after confirming the amount of fuel to buy
Genset well controlled.
Current
Transport/Fleet Department
